newsitem.title: JAPAN: DVD Forum courting NEC to avoid disc format war.
newsitem.headline: DVD Forum courting NEC to avoid disc format war.

text.p: The DVD Forum, a group of 10 digital video disc (DVD) developers led by Toshiba Corp, will ask NEC Corp to join the group in an effort to avert a format war over next-generation rewritable data storage discs, a Toshiba spokesman said on Tuesday.
"We hope NEC will join the DVD camp and make its rewritable disc technology compatible with DVD's," he said. "Talks are likely to start shortly."

Last week, NEC said it would launch its own high-capacity rewritable data storage disc in 1998. The disc will be incompatible with the DVD Forum's DVD-RAM disc scheduled to hit the market at the end of this year.
The high-capacity discs are being developed and marketed to replace video tapes, CDs and CD-ROMs, which offer much lower storage capacity.
NEC's entry into the market followed recent announcements by a group led by Sony Corp and another led by Fujitsu Ltd that they would pursue their own incompatible formats.
A format war will confuse consumers and could put a "psychological brake" on sales of the new discs and disc players, the Toshiba spokesman said.
An NEC spokesman said on Monday that the company has no plans at present to join any of the other groups or to modify its own technology, called multimedia video files (MMVF).
